intro: Mussaenda cuspidata, commonly known as the spiked Mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange to yellow inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Mussaenda cuspidata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring partial shade to full sun and well-drained soil.
